title: Augusta County: John Scott to Samuel Hunt, December 18, 1865
summary: In a typical report to Samuel Hunt, Scott focuses on the recent acquisition of a "Rebel Camp stove" which has helped to provide heat in his classroom. He comments on the beauty of the "'Alleghany' Mts" and mentions a "young man" who has been buying "condemned property" in the Valley and assisting the AMA in Staunton.
keywords: African Americans, Education, Arts/Leisure, Economy, American Civil War
